definitions.definition: The opposition between the human search for meaning in life and the inability to find any; the state or condition in which man exists in an irrational universe and his life has no meaning outside of his existence.
definitions.dating_raw: from early 20th century in English; from mid-19th century in Danish by Kierkegaard

secondary_definitions: ( philosophy , often preceded by the ) The opposition between the human search for meaning in life and the inability to find any; the state or condition in which man exists in an irrational universe and his life has no meaning outside of his existence. [from early 20th century in English; from mid-19th century in Danish by Kierkegaard ]
